content.text: <image 1> A company wants to evaluate its attrition rate, in other words, how long new hires stay with the company. Over the years, they have established the following probability distribution. Let X = the number of years a new hire will stay with the company. Let P(x) = the probability that a new hire will stay with the company x years. P(x = 4) = _______

To find \( P(x = 4) \), we need to look at the row in the table where \( x = 4 \). According to the table:

\[ P(x = 4) = 0.10 \]

final_answer:
To find \( P(x = 4) \), we need to look at the row in the table where \( x = 4 \). According to the table:

\[ P(x = 4) = 0.10 \]
